title: Website for College Students
body:
Hey guys checkout http://leaguebook.org, we built it so people could associate themselves with their college. It ranks colleges against each other and shows you everyone from any given college.

Thanks for checking it out.

replies.body: California State University came out of nowhere last night and now are in 2nd place standings. Dang! OP {{champion:74}}
Yeah I may or may not have snagged a few friends to knock VT up to 3rd, tied with Cal state. Just....a little.....bit....more
I find this pretty awesome, hopefully it will snag more people as time passes. Would love to see anyone else playing at Virginia Tech.
Does Virginia Tech have any LoL groups or LAN parties? I know that some other colleges do. Maybe that would be the place to mention League Book. :)

I heard somewhere that we have a collegiate team and a club, but I can't seem to find it. Although I'll be the first to admit I didn't look very hard.

Honestly I'm an engineering student and I can safely say at least half of VT Engineers play league regularly. So at the very least it's primed and ready for league tournies and events. Only problem is we're all engineering students. Time ain't a luxury we got during the semester :P

You could always schedule gameplay with [nowplay.us](http://nowplay.us). It's another web app that we made up from a hackathon. We made it just for that purpose of busy lifestyle. We actually made a bunch of products because of League... Here's a list if you're interested http://redd.it/1uhvak (all free of course)
hot damn, will take a look, thx!

You should make canadian schools available too. i know there are a lot of peeps at my uni that would be interested in something like this. People always seem to forget canada is part of NA for some reason.
I live close to niagara falls like 30 min from buffalo
This is definitely on the to-do list. LB came out of a two day hackathon, so right now we are just compiling feedback and trying to make it better. More signups = more data = better service. :)
Now that I think about it, depending on where you are in Canada you may actually even get better ping than me (I'm on East Coast). XD
